text: is there a difference between `collect(A')`  and `copy(A')` , if `A` is a matrix/array?

Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Without looking at the code I would say no. Not in the result, but slightly in performance in favor of copy:
```julia> @benchmark copy( ($A)')
BenchmarkTools.Trial:
  memory estimate:  160 bytes
  allocs estimate:  1
  --------------
  minimum time:     34.945 ns (0.00% GC)
  median time:      37.665 ns (0.00% GC)
  mean time:        41.270 ns (5.11% GC)
  maximum time:     1.011 μs (94.61% GC)
  --------------
  samples:          10000
  evals/sample:     993

julia> @benchmark collect( ($A)')
BenchmarkTools.Trial:
  memory estimate:  160 bytes
  allocs estimate:  1
  --------------
  minimum time:     45.859 ns (0.00% GC)
  median time:      49.293 ns (0.00% GC)
  mean time:        53.004 ns (3.98% GC)
  maximum time:     985.455 ns (92.61% GC)
  --------------
  samples:          10000
  evals/sample:     990```
